intro: Eugenia pseudosubtilis var. subacuminata, commonly known as the narrow-acute eugenia, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It typically grows to a height of 3–5 meters and features elliptical leaves with a glossy dark green surface. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, edible berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
